"Over 12 million people are estimated to be stranded in affected areas or unable to leave due to heightened security risks, destruction of...roads...lack of resources or information on where to find safety," it added.

349.title: There were times I'd be desperate when I was about to get dropped: Dhawan
349.article_body: Shikhar Dhawan said there were times when he would be desperate when he was about to be dropped from Team India, adding that he used to compete aggressively. "I have seen...ups and downs playing for the Indian team," stated Dhawan. "T20 World Cup 2022 is coming. If I do well in...IPL 2022, I can get into the side," he said.

350.title: India's forex reserves decline by $9.6 bn in biggest weekly drop in 2 yrs
350.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves declined by $9.646 billion to $622.275 billion in the week ending March 11, marking its biggest weekly drop in nearly two years, data shared by the Reserve Bank of India showed. The decline was on account of a fall in foreign currency assets (FCA), a major component of the overall reserves, which decreased by $11.108 billion.

351.title: Bulgaria won't send military aid to Ukraine: PM Petkov
351.article_body: Bulgarian PM Kiril Petkov said the country will not be able to provide military aid to Ukraine as it's "too close to the conflict". Bulgaria, a NATO ally, will continue to provide humanitarian assistance, he added. Bulgaria also announced that it'll host a new contingent of NATO troops as part of the military alliance's push to strengthen its eastern flank.

352.title: As a leader you have to do it: Gambhir on IPL 2013 spat with Kohli
352.article_body: Discussing his spat with Virat Kohli while leading KKR in an IPL 2013 match against RCB, Gautam Gambhir said, "When you are leading...you have to do it...because you want your team to play...[like] you want." "You are not thinking about personal relationships with the other guy," added Gambhir. Ex-KKR player Rajat Bhatia had to step in and separate them.

353.title: I learnt a lot from bad IPL 2021 season, won't let it change me: Pooran
353.article_body: Having scored 85 runs in 12 IPL 2021 matches for PBKS, West Indies wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran said he has learnt a lot from his "bad" season but won't let it change him as a player. "First game...I got a first-ball duck..., next game...a second-ball duck," added Pooran. Pooran recorded four ducks in his opening six IPL 2021 matches.

354.title: Police probe into hijab row targeted us, alleges CFI's K'taka head
354.article_body: The Karnataka chief of the Campus Front of India (CFI), Athavulla Punjalkatte, has alleged that the police probe into the hijab row was "selective" and "targeted" the organisation. In an interview with the Indian Express, Punjalkatte reacted to the Karnataka High Court's judgement uphold the ban on hijab by saying, "We are with petitioner students and we'll fight it legally."

355.title: 20-year-old arrested for kidnapping & raping 17-year-old girl in UP
355.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police arrested a 20-year-old man for allegedly kidnapping and raping a 17-year-old girl. On December 22, the girl had gone missing from a village under Rasra police station. Her father registered a case on February 16. Acting on a tip-off, the police arrested the accused on Thursday. The girl was sent for medical examination to the district hospital.

356.title: What are the features of Kinzhal hypersonic missiles used by Russia in Ukraine?
356.article_body: Russia has claimed to have used Kinzhal (meaning dagger) hypersonic missiles in Ukraine to blast a weapons' storage. They have a reported range of 1,500-2,000 km and can carry a payload that's 33 times the yield of the Fat Man bomb that was dropped on Hiroshima. They fly at 10 times the speed of sound and can overcome air-defence systems.

357.title: Kiara praises her dad's 'childhood friend' Juhi Chawla, calls her 'aunty'
357.article_body: Kiara Advani, during an interview, referred to Juhi Chawla as "aunty" while revealing that the actress is her father Jagdeep Advani's childhood friend. When pointed out that she called Juhi "aunty", Kiara laughed and said she doesn't think Juhi will "kill" her for it. "She's very grounded. I never felt that she was a huge film star," Kiara further said.

358.title: Ready to ally with Cong or NCP; not 'B' team of BJP: AIMIM MP
358.article_body: Aurangabad MP and AIMIM leader, Imtiaz Jaleel, has said that his party is willing to ally with the NCP and Congress for civic polls in Maharashtra. Jaleel said that it is always alleged that BJP wins because of AIMIM splitting votes. Jaleel added that to prove AIMIM is not a 'B' team of BJP, he "proposed...for the alliance".

359.title: It took me to really dark places: Arjun on 1 yr of 'Sandeep Aur Pinky...'
359.article_body: As 'Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar' completed one year of its release on Saturday, Arjun Kapoor said, "[It] took me to really dark places in my heart." "Though it was extremely uncomfortable for me, it made me deliver a performance that people have called my career-best," he added. Directed by Dibakar Banerjee, the crime drama also featured Parineeti Chopra.

360.title: Pressure like batting on Day 1: Du Plessis on first RCB training session
360.article_body: RCB captain Faf Du Plessis compared his first RCB training session after three days of quarantine, to the pressure of batting on the first day in a Test match. Du Plessis will be leading an IPL franchise for the first time, having replaced Virat Kohli who was the franchise's captain from 2013 to 2021. He has played 100 IPL matches.

361.title: Noida, Ghaziabad to host school books exchange fair tomorrow
361.article_body: Ghaziabad Parents Association and Gautam Budh Nagar Parents Welfare Society will organise a school books exchange fair tomorrow. Parents will be able to donate their child's old school books and in return, they can get books donated by others for their child's new academic session. The fair will be held in Noida's Sector 52 community hall and Ghaziabad's Shastri Nagar.

362.title: Which superyachts owned by Russians have been seized due to the war in Ukraine?
362.article_body: Several superyachts have been seized from Russian oligarchs after sanctions by US and European Union due to Ukraine war. The seized superyachts include 213-foot Lady M owned by Alexei Mordashov, Gennady Timchenko's 132-foot Lena, Andrey Melnichenko's 470-foot-long Sy A, 279-foot Valerie, 289-foot Amore Vero owned by Igor Sechin, 450-foot Dilbar and 445-foot Crescent and 157-foot Lady Anastasia.

363.title: 112 children killed in ongoing war in Ukraine: Official
363.article_body: At least 112 children have been killed in the war in Ukraine so far, the Ukrainian prosecutor general's office said on Saturday. Around 140 children have been injured, it added. On Friday, scores of empty strollers were lined up in the central square of Lviv city to commemorate the children killed in the country since Russia's invasion.

364.title: Kohli forces himself to hit by using the crease in the powerplay: Jaffer
364.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said it seems like Virat Kohli forces himself to hit by using the crease in the powerplay, adding that Kohli should bat at number three rather than opening the innings for RCB. "Kohli's somebody who takes some time initially and then his strike rate progressively goes up," stated Jaffer. Kohli scored 405 runs in IPL 2021.

365.title: 16-yr-old girl shot in back, lungs by Russian soldiers while saving brother, survives
365.article_body: A 16-year-old Ukrainian girl was shot in the back, lungs, ribs and thighs by Russian troops while covering her eight-year-old brother from the attack. The girl survived the attack and is currently hospitalised in Kyiv. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy also visited the girl and her family at the hospital and gave her a bouquet of pink and white flowers.

366.title: Drunk man stabs self 4 times while dancing on Holi in MP, video surfaces
366.article_body: A man who appeared to be drunk stabbed himself four times with a knife while dancing during a Holi celebration in MP's Indore. A video of the incident shows the man accidentally stabbing himself while reportedly appearing to pull off a stunt. He was rushed to a hospital where he succumbed to his injuries, police said.

367.title: Czech designer makes 'Zelenskyy pillows', raises over ₹14 lakh for Ukraine
367.article_body: A Czech designer is making pillows bearing the portrait of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who according to him has become a “sex symbol” for some. Tomas Brinek said that he has already received 2,000 orders for these pillows and has raised $18,900 (over ₹14 lakh) for a charity helping Ukrainians amid the war.

368.title: Our film important too: 'Jhund' maker as Kashmir Files declared tax-free
368.article_body: Reacting to 'The Kashmir Files' being made tax-free in multiple states across the country, Savita Raj Hiremath, one of the producers of 'Jhund', said she's "perplexed" as to why her film wasn't declared tax-free. She said 'Jhund' is also an important film and has a subject "that's crucial to our country's growth". 'Jhund', starring Amitabh Bachchan, released on March 4.

369.title: 23-yr-old man arrested for raping class 10 girl in Karnataka
369.article_body: A 23-year-old man was arrested by Karnataka's Annigeri Police on Friday for allegedly raping a class 10 girl. The accused took the minor to a field forcibly on his bike, raped her repeatedly and also threatened to kill her if she disclosed the matter to anybody, police said. Her parents, however, lodged a police complaint after learning about the crime.

370.title: Japan's PM arrives for 2-day visit, Railways Minister welcomes him
370.article_body: Japan's PM Fumio Kishida arrived in Delhi on Saturday for his two-day visit and was welcomed by Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. He is scheduled to participate in the 14th India-Japan annual summit and hold bilateral talks with PM Narendra Modi. This is Kishida's first visit to India after taking office last year and his first meeting with PM Modi.

371.title: At least 12 migrants drown in shipwreck off Tunisia
371.article_body: At least 12 migrants, mostly Syrians, drowned in a shipwreck off Tunisia on Friday as they tried to cross the Mediterranean Sea to Italy, a civil protection official said. As per reports, several people have drowned off the Tunisian coast in recent months, with an increase in the frequency of attempted crossings to Europe from Tunisia and Libya towards Italy.

372.title: Mario Balotelli dropped from Italy squad for FIFA WC playoffs
372.article_body: Italian footballer Mario Balotelli was dropped from the country's squad for next week's FIFA World Cup playoff match. Earlier, Balotelli was recalled to the national team in January after almost three years. However, Luiz Felipe and Joao Pedro were included in the 33-member national squad. Italy will play against North Macedonia in a must-win game on March 25.

373.title: Rafael Nadal is like a computer, he can see through motion: Annacone
373.article_body: Tennis commentator Paul Annacone said Rafael Nadal's mind is like a computer, adding that he can "see through motion" on the tennis court to make good decisions which is tough. "It's been so much fun to watch Rafa [solve problems] and find...ways to get through matches," stated Annacone. Nadal recently recorded his 19th consecutive win in the ATP Tour season.

374.title: Nawab Malik will have to resign, divesting portfolio not enough: Fadnavis
374.article_body: NCP leader Nawab Malik will have to resign and divesting portfolio is not enough, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said. "We'll not relent until he resigns. His continuation in the Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government as a Cabinet minister is not only unethical but goes against the spirit of the Constitution," Fadnavis added. ED arrested Malik in a money laundering case.

375.title: Some films inspire change, Kashmir Files incites hate: Cong's Jairam
375.article_body: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Saturday criticised the newly-released 'The Kashmir Files' and said that while some films inspire change, the Vivek Agnihotri directorial incites hate. "Truth can lead to justice, rehabilitation, reconciliation and peace. Propaganda twists facts, distorts history to whip up anger and promote violence," he tweeted. Several BJP members have lauded the movie.

376.title: Father, brother, grandfather, uncle rape 11-year-old girl over 5 years in Pune
376.article_body: Pune Police have booked an 11-year-old girl's father, brother, grandfather and uncle for allegedly raping and sexually assaulting her over the last five years. Her father allegedly raped her when they lived in Bihar in 2017 and she was later raped by her brother when she moved to Pune. Her grandfather and uncle sexually abused her last year, FIR stated.

377.title: Ferry firm that fired 800 workers on Zoom call can face unlimited fine: UK govt
377.article_body: UK Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng wrote to P&O Ferries, a shipping company that fired 800 employees over a three-minute Zoom call. Kwarteng said failure to give sufficient notice of large-scale redundancies, via the Insolvency Service and the Redundancy Payment Service, "is a criminal offence and can lead to an unlimited fine". Meanwhile, protests erupted against P&O Ferries across UK ports.

378.title: My first season in the IPL in 2019 with RCB was challenging: Hetmyer
378.article_body: Shimron Hetmyer admitted that IPL 2019 which marked his first season in the IPL, and saw him representing RCB was "challenging". "Being the only West Indian in the squad was tough," said Hetmyer. Hetmyer scored 90 runs in five matches in IPL 2019. He will represent RR in IPL 2022 having been signed for ₹8.50 crore in the mega auction.

379.title: Suzuki Motor to invest ₹9,569 cr for EV production in India: Report
379.article_body: Japan's Suzuki Motor plans to invest about ₹9,569 crore to produce electric vehicles and batteries in India, Reuters reported citing the Nikkei's report. Suzuki aims to build a new electric vehicle production line in India and start operations as early as 2025. Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is visiting India on Saturday to meet Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

380.title: NDRF personnel deployed in Andaman and Nicobar ahead of Cyclone Asani
380.article_body: National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel have been deployed in Andaman and Nicobar Islands as IMD predicted Cyclone Asani over Bay of Bengal on March 21. According to the administration, NDRF personnel are ready at different places with all necessary equipment to carry out search and rescue operations. "Fishermen are strongly advised not to venture into sea," the administration tweeted.

381.title: Varun to team up with Atlee for Hindi remake of South film: Reports
381.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan and filmmaker Atlee are reportedly teaming up for the Hindi remake of a South film. "There's a good chance that the film may be Vijay and Samantha starrer 'Theri'," reports stated. The original, which was released in 2016, was also helmed by Atlee. Meanwhile, the filmmaker is currently working on a film with Shah Rukh Khan.

382.title: An honour to play for India: Jhulan on becoming 2nd woman to play 200 ODIs
382.article_body: After she became the second woman cricketer to play 200 ODIs, following India captain Mithali Raj, pacer Jhulan Goswami said it's been an honour to play for India. The 39-year-old achieved this feat in India's match against Australia on Saturday in 2022 Women's World Cup. "It's been a pleasure, whenever I've worn this jersey. It's always been special," Jhulan added.

383.title: Pune's APMC seizes mangoes falsely being sold as Ratnagiri Alphonso
383.article_body: Pune's Agriculture Produce Market Committee (APMC) has seized 42 boxes of mangoes being falsely sold as Alphonso mangoes from Ratnagiri by three wholesale dealers, an official said on Saturday. The seized mangoes had arrived from Karnataka, the official added. Alphonso mangoes from Karnataka are cheaper than the Ratnagiri Alphonso, a mango trader said.

384.title: Just imagine 14,000 dead bodies in that Russian stadium: Zelenskyy on Putin's speech
384.article_body: Commenting on Russian President Vladimir Putin's speech at a packed soccer stadium, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Just picture for yourself that in that stadium in Moscow there are 14,000 dead bodies...Those are the Russian costs throughout the invasion." Zelenskyy warned that Russia will lose in the long run if it doesn't end its war.

385.title: Profile of the world's most boring person released by researchers in the UK
385.article_body: British researchers have revealed the profile of the world's most boring person, based on a study on 500 people. The study summed up that the world's most boring person would be a data entry worker who's religious, lives in a town and whose favourite hobby is watching TV. Data analysis, accounting are among the most boring jobs, the study said.

386.title: Baltic countries expel 10 Russian diplomats amid Ukraine war
386.article_body: Latvia, Estonia, and Lithuania have expelled a total of 10 Russian diplomats amid the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine, the foreign ministries of the three Baltic nations said. Lithuania has expelled four Russian diplomats, while Estonia and Latvia have expelled three each. "All ungrounded expulsions of Russian diplomats will be met with an appropriate answer," Russia's Foreign Ministry said.

387.title: Businessman to give away free gas worth $1 million as prices hit record high in US
387.article_body: US businessman Willie Wilson has announced that he would be giving away $1 million worth of gas free of cost to Cook County residents from March 24 as prices hit record high in the country. Earlier this week, several cars lined up at gas stations after he announced $200,000 worth of free gas at 10 stations in the city.

388.title: Elon Musk says first humans could land on Mars in 2029
388.article_body: SpaceX CEO in response to a Twitter user said the first humans could land on Mars in 2029. The user had posted a photo showing the 1969 Moon landing along with an image of people on Mars that read, "20_ _?" Last year, Musk had said, in a worst-case scenario, SpaceX would land humans on Mars in 10 years.

389.title: Organs of brain dead man give new lease of life to 6 patients in K'taka
389.article_body: Umesh B Dandagi (51), who was declared brain dead at KLES Hospital in Karnataka's Belagavi, gave new lease of life to six patients. His heart was transplanted to a patient in the same hospital. His kidneys were sent to their respective recipients through green corridor and liver was airlifted to Bengaluru. His corneas and skin were donated to respective banks.

390.title: Anushka Sharma steps away from her production house
390.article_body: Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to announce she's stepping away from her production house Clean Slate Filmz (CSF) which she co-founded with her brother Karnesh. "Being a new mother who has chosen to be an actor by profession...I've decided...whatever time I've at hand...I'll dedicate it to my first love, acting!" she wrote. Clean Slate Filmz was founded in October 2013.

391.title: Camilla takes over Meghan Markle's former theatre patronage
391.article_body: Prince Charles' wife Camilla has taken over Meghan Markle's former theatre patronage. In a tweet, the National Theatre welcomed the Duchess of Cornwall as its Royal Patron. The move makes Camilla one of the first members of royal family to take up Meghan's former royal duties. Notably, National Theatre was among the four patronages passed on to Meghan in 2019.

392.title: 45-yr-old man thrashed to death after argument during Holi celebration
392.article_body: A 45-year-old man, Rajendra, was allegedly beaten to death on Friday following an argument during Holi celebration in Gurugram. After learning about his brother Sonu's clash with his brother-in-law Mithun, the deceased reportedly visited Mithun to sort the matter out where he was attacked with bricks and sticks. He was rushed to a hospital but doctors declared him brought dead.

393.title: Putin fired around 1,000 staff members fearing they would poison him: Report
393.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin allegedly fired about 1,000 personal staff members in February over fears that they would poison him, said a report. Citing a government source, the report said that those who were fired, included cooks, bodyguards, launderers, and secretaries. The report also said that in Russia, the preferred method of assassination is poisoning.

394.title: Every film has its own destiny: Pooja Hegde on mixed reviews for Radhe Shyam
394.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde while talking about receiving mixed reviews for her recently released film 'Radhe Shyam' said every film has its own destiny at the box office. "Sometimes you watch a film and you think it's an okay film but the box office does really well," she added. However, the actress said people praised her despite the film's overall performance.

395.title: 3 attack man with iron rod after he refused to give 'hafta' in Pune; held
395.article_body: Police have arrested three persons for attacking a man with an iron rod in Pune's Kondhwa. The victim alleged the accused told him that they were the goons of the area and he'll have to pay them regular protection money (hafta). However, when he rejected their demand, they attacked him and robbed him of his gold chain worth ₹1.05 lakh.

396.title: 72-yr-old auto-rickshaw driver held for molesting, kidnapping minor in Delhi
396.article_body: A 72-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was arrested for allegedly molesting and kidnapping an 11-year-old girl from Delhi's Bengali Market area on the Barakhamba Road. "The incident came to light on March 17 after the victim's parents...informed...their daughter had gone missing," police said. "The accused was trying to escape with the girl to Uttarakhand's Haridwar," police added.

397.title: 4,000 bikers penalised for not using a helmet on Holi in Mumbai
397.article_body: The Mumbai Police conducted a special drive on Holi and penalised 4,130 bikers for not using helmets. A total of 8,276 fines were issued from Thursday midnight to 7 pm on Friday. As per data, 1,876 fines were issued for violating parking norms, 110 were penalised for wrong side driving and 199 abandoned vehicles were cleared.

398.title: MI miscalculated, they'll surely miss Boult: Rajkumar ahead of IPL 2022
398.article_body: Rajkumar Sharma, childhood coach of Virat Kohli, said MI will miss pacer Trent Boult in upcoming IPL 2022 as he wasn't retained by them in mega auction last month. He added that the Mumbai-based franchise "miscalculated" before the auction. "To make up for Boult's absence, they went for Jaydev Unadkat," Rajkumar added. Boult was bought by RR for ₹8 crore.

399.title: Will hold protests if railway concessions for senior citizens not restored: Pune Cong
399.article_body: Congress' Pune unit has warned the Centre that it will hold protests if concessions for senior citizens on railway tickets are not restored. Congress spokesperson Gopal Tiwari said concession helps senior citizens "in religious journeys and to visit other places". Tiwari added, "We condemn the decision of the Central government."

400.title: Ethereum's billionaire co-founder shares tweets trolling him for TIME cover
400.article_body: Vitalik Buterin, who co-founded the world's second-largest cryptocurrency Ethereum, on Saturday shared screenshots of tweets trolling him for his TIME magazine cover. The billionaire said, "The...tweets...are truly amazing. These are barely even cherry-picked...Highly recommend scrolling." The 28-year-old Russia-born Canadian is among the most influential people in the cryptocurrency world.
